intro: Didymocarpus serratus, commonly known as the serrated didymocarp, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its leaves are alternate and serrated, contributing to its common name. Didymocarpus serratus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
